statement:
**Theorem** If $B$ is a subring of $A$ and $u_1,\ldots,u_s\in A$ are
integral over $B$, then $B[u_1,\ldots,u_s]$ is module-finite over $B$.

**Proof.** If $s=1$ then $u^n+b_1 u^{n-1}+\cdots+b_n=0$, so
$\{1,u,\ldots,u^{n-1}\}$ spans $B[u]$ over $B$.

If $s>1$, use induction on
$B\subset B[u_1]\subset B[u_1,u_2]\subset\ldots\subset B[u_1,\ldots,u_s]$
and multiply the spanning sets together.
